Using the links at the top of this page, you can find a history of my accomplishments as an IT professional along with a list of freelance services I provide.
If you would like to reach out, please feel free to email me or connect on LinkedIn using the links above.

I spent my time from December 2016 through July 2021 as a Head Technician for an independant electronic repair shop.
As a repair tech, I was tasked with evaluation, diagnosis, and repair of hardware and software issues with various types of consumer electronics. While I primarily worked with computers, I was also exposed to other devices like phones, tablets, printers, and various pieces of specialty equipment.
The primary skillset of a role like this is obviously knowledge of computer hardware and software, but an often overlooked element is communication. When an end user trusts you with what is often one of the most expensive things they own, it is imperitive that you treat both their belongings and them with respect. I pride myself on my ability to ensure that clients are kept in the loop and that the job is done quickly and thoroughly.
title: Computer Hardware & Software Repair

content: From April of 2022 to now I have worked in Enterprise IT Support, specifically in the Education industry. My experience in this specific sector of IT has provided exposure to structured support and management including but not limited to end user support, account management, computer system management, and computer system deployment.
title: Enterprise IT Support

content:
Starting November of 2022, I began diving into the world of Systems Administration.
Starting by getting involved with Service Management/Ticketing Systems, I found myself learning the ins and outs of programming languages like TypeScript and HTML. This allowed me to manage and update various service offerings both on the user and service side of the platform.
I was then introduced to MDM management. My work in our MDM portal consisted of managing device parameters, software deployment scripts, and inventory tracking.
Most recently, I have found myself as the primary admin for my company’s email security testing and training platform. I am tasked with creating, tracking, and managing various security testing and training campaigns along with creating and managing templates used to send communications to end users.
title: Systems Administration
